intro: Gnaphalium americanum var. discolor, commonly known as the American everlasting, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and sandy soils. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and usually yellow or white. The plant is known for its long-lasting flowers, which give it its common name.
